data.title: UNDERSTAND
questions: In this phase, get them to describe their present situation.
What's up?  What’s happening right now?
What do you know about this situation?
What do you not know, but would like to know?
How can you find out?
What’s your current thinking about it?
How is this situation impacting your performance?
What makes this challenging for you? How so?
What’s in it for you personally to get back on track?

data.title: BRAINSTORM
questions: In this phase, facilitate their brainstorming of possible options.
What else could be going on? Such as…?
What are you assuming? Inferring? Any potential biases?
What could YOU do about this? What else could you do?
If you could do anything, what would you do?
How can you stay open to other possibilities?
What do you want to happen? What’s your ideal outcome?
What’s one small step you could take toward that?
What have you learned (about yourself) from this?
What else has this taught you?
Summarize your options.

data.title: EVALUATE
questions: In this phase, help them select the best way forward.
What course of action has the most potential?
What do you like about it? What’s in it for you?
What's motivating you to pursue this option?
What about doing this gives you hesitation or concern?
To what extent will it stretch your comfort zone? How will you respond?
Who could you enlist to help you? How could they help?
How will you approach and influence them to help you?
How do you increase your confidence about this?
How will you feel when successful?
How will you reward yourself?

data.title: IMPLEMENT
questions: In this phase, get them to be explicit about their follow-thru.
So what's your plan? What exactly are you going to do?
What will you do first? By when? What then?
What challenges or barriers do you foresee?
What sources of power do you have?
How will you tackle these obstacles head-on?
How will you persevere and make it happen?
How will you hold yourself accountable?
Would you like to check back with me? When?
When do you take that first step?
